title: SQL ServerDATALENGTH()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerDATALENGTH()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the length of an expression (in bytes):
SELECT 
  DATALENGTH('.com');

Definition and Usage
The DATALENGTH() function returns the number of bytes used to represent an 
expression.
Note:
The DATALENGTH() function counts both leading and 
trailing spaces when calculating the length of the expression.
Tip:
Also see the
LEN()
function.
Syntax
DATALENGTH(
expression
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
expression
Required. The data type to return the length for. If
expression
is NULL, it returns NULL
Technical Details
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2008), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse, Parallel Data Warehouse
More Examples
Example
Return the length of an expression (in bytes) (counts both leading and 
trailing spaces):
SELECT 
  DATALENGTH('   .com   ');

Example
Return the length of an expression (in bytes):
SELECT 
  DATALENGTH('2017-08');

❯
★
+1

quiz.question:
What is If
expression?
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of If
expression is 'NULL'.

summary: This tutorial covers SQL ServerDATALENGTH()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQL ServerDATALENGTH()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQL ServerDATALENGTH()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
